active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Topic: Periodic Access Reviews (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Personnel Security > During Employment Security > Access Control and Authorization > Periodic Access Reviews). Voter consensus: 100% approval on pedagogy/completeness. Core Content: Integrate research summary (definitions: access privileges, least privilege, RBAC, periodic reviews, recertification; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5 AC-02/AC-06; HITRUST CSF 09.ac-4/ID.AC-P1), voter priorities (prerequisites: access control basics; big picture: lifecycle, Zero Trust, privilege creep), and scaffolding layers [insert full scaffolding_layers from JSON]. Learning Objectives: [insert full learning_objectives from JSON]. Active Learning: Flashcards should test/prepare for [insert full active_learning_components from JSON]; include hints referencing these. Generate flashcards following exact schema: [insert full flashcard_generation_schema from JSON]. Output ONLY in JSON array: [{'type': 'Q&A|MCQ|Fill|Scenario', 'front': '...', 'back': {answer: '...', explanation: '...', blooms_level: '...', reference: '...', active_tiein: '...', prerequisite: '...'}}, ...]. Group by scaffolding layer. Ensure high-quality, exam-ready (CISSP-style), no fluff.
